comments.body: Uhh, will this not explode if `mysql_driver` is `None`? Could we make an assertion here? I assume this function is only called internally by the module and therefore we can give any developer a hard stop if they're missing the dependency.

I think that all the modules should have checked this and called fail_json() if it was None before they call mysql_connect().  There is a fragility in depending on that but it's no different than previously where mysqldb_found was being used for the same purpose.
